Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Natto peptide (natural AMPs; bacteria, prokaryotes; BBMm; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Isolated from a Japanese soybean fermented food in the presence of bacteria that produced this peptide. It has a very narrow activity spectrum.Activity: Active against Gram+ B.cereus JCM 2152T or AHU 1358 (MIC>128 ug/ml), B. licheniformis AHU 1371 (MIC 8 ug/ml), B.megaterium AHU 1373 (MIC >128 ug/ml),  B. pumilus AHU 1386 (MIC 8 ug/ml), B. subtilis 6 strains (MIC 8-16 ug/ml), E.faecalis s strains HU1 VRE (MIC>128 ug/ml), L. fermentum ATCC 9338 (MIC 64 ug/ml), L.plantarum NRIC 1067T (MIC>128 ug/ml), L.rhamnosus ATCC 7469T (MIC > 128 ug/ml), S.aureus ATCC 25923 3 strains MRSA (MIC>128 ug/ml), S. agalactiae JCM 5671T (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. mitis JCM 12971T (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. mutans JCM 5705T (MIC 64 ug/ml),  S. pneumoniae ATCC 49619 and 6 strains (MIC 8-16 ug/ml),  S.pyogenes JCM 5674T (MIC 128 ug/ml), S.salivarius JCM 5707T (MIC 128 ug/ml),  S. sanguinis JCM 5708T (MIC 64 ug/ml), Gram- A.baumannii ATCC 19606T or SRAC2 (MIC >128 ug/ml),  E.coli ATCC 25922 and 2 strains (MIC >128 ug/ml),  H.infuenza ATCC 51907 (MIC >128 ug/ml),  P.aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC >128 ug/ml), S.marcescens SRSM2 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), fungi C.albicans SRCA1 (MIC > 128 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: serum-sensitive; p>Structure: helix?MOA:bacteria: The bacterial peptide appears to work on bacterial membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Kitagawa M, Shiraishi T, Yamamoto S, Kutomi R, Ohkoshi Y, Sato T, Wakui H, Itoh H, Miyamoto A, Yokota SI.2017
Literature Information.Title: Novel antimicrobial activities of a peptide derived from a Japanese soybean fermented food, Natto, against Streptococcus pneumoniae and Bacillus subtilis group strains.
